Name.label: Congenital hereditary facial paralysis-variable hearing loss syndrome

TextSection.Contents: Congenital hereditary facial paralysis-variable hearing loss syndrome is an extremely rare autosomal recessive disorder characterized by bilateral facial palsy with masked facies, sensorineural hearing loss, dysmorphic features (midfacial retrusion, low-set ears), and strabismus.

Name.label: BTNT (broader term maps to a narrower term)
BTNT (broader term maps to a narrower term)

Synonym.label: Congenital hereditary facial palsy with variable deafness
Congenital hereditary facial palsy with variable hearing loss
